qas.question: How many genetic variants are shown to decrease risk of an MI?
PCSK9 is found in what locus?
How many genetic variants are in the 9p21 genomic locus?
What was implicated in the coding region of 9p21?
SORT1 is associated with decreasing risk of what?

context: Genome-wide association studies have found <b0_0><b2_0>27<b2_0/><b0_0/> genetic variants that are associated with an increased risk of <b4_0>myocardial infarction<b4_0/>. Strongest association of MI has been found with the <b1_0>9p21<b1_0/> genomic locus, which contains genes <b3_0>CDKN2A & 2B<b3_0/>, although the single nucleotide polymorphisms that are implicated are within a non-coding region. The majority of these variants are in regions that have not been previously implicated in coronary artery disease. The following genes have an association with MI: PCSK9, SORT1, MIA3, WDR12, MRAS, PHACTR1, LPA, TCF21, MTHFDSL, ZC3HC1, CDKN2A, 2B, ABO, PDGF0, APOA5, MNF1ASM283, COL4A1, HHIPC1, SMAD3, ADAMTS7, RAS1, SMG6, SNF8, LDLR, SLC5A3, MRPS6, KCNE2.
